title: Set up the integral
text: We will start by converting the word problem into the mathematical expession. According to the Net change theorem, the rate of change of surface of a cube formula will be integrated with the boundaries go from $$x=s$$ to $$x=2s$$.

title: Set up the integral

subHints.title: Set up the integral
subHints.text: The surface of a cube formula originally is $$6x^2$$ with $$x$$ is the length of the cube.

title: Net change theorem
text: The Net Change Theorem giving the integral for determining change in a function F(x) when $$x$$ changes from a to $$b$$ is stated as $$F(b)-F(a)=\int_{a}^{b} \frac{d}{\operatorname{dx}\left(F\left(x\right)\right)} \,dx$$
speech: The Net Change Theorem giving the integral for determining change in a function F(x) when  x  changes from a to  b  is stated as    f of b minus   f of a is equal to the integral from a to b of fraction, d over, dx of   f of x,  d x

is stated as     f of b minus   f of a is equal to the integral from a to b of fraction, d over, dx of   f of x,  d x
